alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 6:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Ecorse Creek At Dearborn Heights affecting Wayne County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ecorse Creek at Dearborn Heights. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river should crest this morning and drop back below flood stage later today. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Impact...The river will overflow is banks this morning before edging back down this afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=DTX. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM EST.
